bibl.title: Letter from George W. Arnett to Philip Showalter Hench, October 28, 1940

div1.p: Arnett congratulates Hench on his honorary degree and hopes to visit him in Rochester.

div1.head: Letter from George W. Arnett to Philip Showalter Hench, October 28, 1940

opener.dateline:
GEORGE W. ARNETT
123 EAST STATE STREET
TRENTON, NEW JERSEY
October 28, 1940

div1.p:
We had only received the news of your having
been given an honorary degree by Washington and
Jefferson when we opened a magazine and saw the picture
which is enclosed. If the present rate continues, you
will certainly need all of those benches to make a place
for the filing of the honorary degrees. Seriously,
Annabel and I were delighted to hear the news and we
send you our most enthusiastic congratulations.

Maybe one of these days I will find myself
in a senior capacity and then it won't be possible for
somebody else to make plans which take preference over
mine. It was a bitter disappointment to have to forego
the trip to Rochester last September but we are not
going to give up trying.

With our very best to Mary and the children,
I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, George W. Arnett Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
